threads.com:
I'm a sick duck edition

>Who is /fat/ for?
For flabby fats who are working towards a better physique through meaningful hard-work, strategy, and dedication. This is not QTDDTOT, stick to questions on fat loss. Post height and weight when asking for advice.
Join our Fatty Contest: https://www.fattycontest.com/

>What do I do first?
1. Read https://physiqonomics.com/fat-loss/
2. Calculate your Body Fat Percentage: https://fitness.bizcalcs.com/Calculator.asp?Calc=Body-Fat-Navy
3. Calculate your TDEE: https://www.sailrabbit.com/bmr/
Remember to use bodyfat% and use Katch-McArdle Formula with sedentary settings or your TDEE will be too high.
4. Plan your weight loss: https://www.losertown.org/eats/cal.php
5. Track your nutrition with MyFitnessPal (better for packaged food), Cronometer (better for generic food/macros) or LoseIt (great for both).

>Now what?
Count calories, all of them.
Eat about 500-1000 less calories than your TDEE.
Buy scales, be accurate.
Learn to cook. Try to stick to lean protein and green vegetables.
Eat a lot of protein. 0.72g per lb of goal lean body mass.
Doing cardio, even just walking, will improve your health. There is no such thing as a healthy fat heart, but you can offset the risks.
Lifting weights will keep and gain muscle mass and burn fat much quicker. No lifting results in the body burning away muscle AND fat.
Drink more water.
Read the /fit/ sticky: https://liamrosen.com/fitness.html

>DON'T
Eat refined sugars, they're terrible for you regardless of calories.
Eat processed foods.
Drink your calories (alcohol, soda, starbucks).
Freak out over a weight loss stall. Plateaus can last up to three weeks.
"Reward" yourself. Cheat days cheat only yourself.

>Other resources:
Loose skin, gyno & stretch marks: https://weight-loss-side-effects.netlify.app/
Reddit wiki: https://www.reddit.com/r/loseit/wiki/faq

Did you run today, /fit/?

previous: >>68969886

>Advice for new runners
- Try to keep your cadence high (at or around 180 steps per minute)
- Try to keep your heartrate in Zone1/2 (around an average of 55-65% of your max. heart rate)
- Build up speed and mileage SLOOOOWLY (start with 15 minutes, increase time/mileage by 10% per week)
- Yes, it will feel like you're going slow, you are; don't worry about setting good times for at least a couple months
- If you start to feel pain anywhere, stop and rest, then run a shorter distance next time or walk
- Don't worry about form, the human body knows how to run, just do what comes naturally
- If you can comfortably run 6 miles at one time, start thinking about what your goal race is, and look for a training routine for that race.

You are genuinely retarded if you think that dog food is just the organs that are unwanted from the livestock that otherwise provides high-quality fresh meat for humans. A lot of what goes into dog food is meat from the livestock industry that is diseased, rancid, rotting or otherwise unfit for human consumption, which is subsequently sterilized at high heat and turned into a homogeneous mass that has many names, including "meal". Think meat with tumors, meat riddled with pus and cysts, rotting meat that cannot be sold for human consumption, or animals/body parts that don't really have a market among human consumers, like horses and bodyparts like the colon. You might just be getting a significant percentage of normal muscle meat that was simply too infected, small, cancerous, diseased, or rotten to sell to humans--- you have no guarantee you're actually getting much organ meat.

And then you have fillers that couldn't be included in more-regulated human foods, which CAN be used for less-regulated animal food and extend the product while having higher contaminants/ poor nutrition / no nutritional value at all, and which wreak havoc on your body and digestive tract. In fact, many industrially-produced dog foods like this notoriously make dogs constipated or give them digestive issues because the filler doesn't absorb and it makes them have to poop a lot more than they would with their natural diet. And because they don't have much nutritional value, dogs get hungry a lot faster after eating than if you just fed them whole meats/foods.

It's dog food because it is lower quality in pretty much every conceivable axis of consideration--- contaminants, fillers, quality of the input meat, nutritional value, etc. I know you're trolling with this post but if you weren't, you'd probably just be hilariously pranking yourself and dying a lot younger

This is where so many people fuck up desu. You’ll have the most energy for bench press but each exercise after that will get progressively shittier in terms of how much you can actually output.

Do less.

Or just pick two. Go heavy on the first exercise and lighter on the second. So like 2-3 sets of bench press in the 4-8 rep range, then 2-3 sets of OHP in the 6-15 rep range.

Train close to failure.

Honestly start with 2 sets and focus on progressive overload. If you stall, add a set.

If fatigue is still bad, you’re fucking up your rest of nutrition.

high amounts of carbohydrates

ideally you get to the stage im at where junk food makes you sick just thinking about it
